Inputs section infers PAUTB as primary input but evidence shows VSAM read for XREF first and IMS as output; no explicit VSAM input documented
Business rule BR001 conditions marked '(inferred)' without direct code citation for comparison
Data flow reads_from cites 137,140,143 for IMS fields like WS-AVAILABLE-AMT, but lines 137+ are moves for output buffer/response

challenger_questions.question: Business rule BR001 cites line 149 for setting WS-DECLINE-REASON-FLG to 'I' on insufficient funds, but line 149 shows 'MOVE XREF-ACCT-ID TO PA-ACCT-ID'. Where is the actual insufficient funds logic?
Business rule BR002 cites line 150 for card not active decline to 'A', but line 150 is 'EXEC DLI ISRT USING PCB(PAUT-PCB-NUM)'. Does this match the decline logic?
Business rule BR003 cites line 151 for account closed decline to 'C', but line 151 is continuation of DLI ISRT 'SEGMENT (PAUTSUM0)'. Is the citation accurate?

issues_found: Purpose inaccurately describes all fields as under PA-AUTHORIZATION-KEY group; only packed date/time fields are nested (lines 21-22).
program_type 'UTILITY' is incorrect for a data definition copybook.
Purpose citations include line 19 (comments), but structure starts at line 20.
Business rules citations are offset by 1-2 lines from actual 88-level definitions.
Paragraph summary has systematically incorrect line numbers for fields (off by ~1).
calling_context is empty, but paragraphs lists detailed incoming_calls from 8 programs.

challenger_questions.question: Purpose summary states 'fields under the group item PA-AUTHORIZATION-KEY, including authorization timestamps, card details, merchant information,...', but line 20 defines 05 PA-AUTHORIZATION-KEY containing only lines 21-22 (10-level packed date/time), while line 25 PA-CARD-NUM and subsequent fields are parallel 05-level items not nested under it.
Why is program_type documented as 'UTILITY' in purpose when this is a non-executable COPYBOOK defining an IMS segment layout with no procedural code (lines 1-55 all comments and data definitions)?

The purpose summary claims database name at line 18 (actual line 19 PASFL-DBDNAME), segment level at line 19 (actual 20), PCB status at line 20 (actual 21), processing options at line 21 (actual 22), segment name at line 23 (actual 24), key feedback name at line 24 (actual 25), number of sensitive segments at line 25 (actual 26), and key feedback area at line 26 (actual 27). Why are all field line numbers off by one?

Business rules section is empty, but critical IMS PCB fields like PASFL-PCB-PROCOPT at line 22 (e.g., 'GNP', 'GU') and PASFL-PCB-STATUS at line 21 (e.g., '  ', 'GE') enforce DL/I call options and error conditions. What business rules govern these fields?

issues_found: Inaccurate or mismatched citations throughout, e.g., inputs CARDDEMO-COMMAREA cites line 110 (CICS LINK WS-FRAUD-DATA) instead of line 23 (receive from DFHCOMMAREA); ROLL-BACK cited 565,569 vs. lines 1-6.

Many documentation citations (e.g., 311, 439, 525) reference lines beyond the provided snippet, preventing full verification; snippet line numbers do not align with doc citations (e.g., MAIN-PARA at ~8-58 vs. 157).
Data flow citations like 436 for reads_from PENDING-AUTH-SUMMARY not verifiable; actual reads via PERFORM READ-AUTH-RECORD at line 91.
